definition: to turn a page/(fig.) to turn over a new leaf
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
sheet/piece of writing/bound set of bamboo slips used for record keeping (old)/classifier for written items: chapter, article
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
to turn over old accounts/fig. to revive old quarrels/to reopen old wounds
to part without hard feelings (idiom)/to cut the knot as smoothly as you tied it
a real man doesn't boast about his past achievements (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 han4 bu4 ti2 dang1 nian2 yong3

definition: better to just get the pain over with, rather than prolong the agony

definition: to regard as unimportant/to be indifferent to (fame, wealth etc)/(of an economy or a market) to slacken
